dt: {bc}to convey in addition to exact explicit meaning

dt.t: For her, the word "family" {wi}connotes{/wi} love and comfort.

dt: {bc}to be associated with or inseparable from as a consequence or concomitant

dt.t: the remorse so often {it}connoted{/it} by guilt

et: Medieval Latin {it}connotare{/it}, from Latin {it}com-{/it} + {it}notare{/it} to note
shortdef: to convey in addition to exact explicit meaning
to imply as a logical connotation
to be associated with or inseparable from as a consequence or concomitant
